page.title: 09RELIGION IN OSSINGTON (2)
page.content: Although the majority of people in Ossington are{Anglicans}there are {Methodists}and{Catholics}resident in the area. The nave of the church is filled with several memorials, mostly dedicated to the{Dennison}family. One of the stained glass windows is in memory of{Lady Elinor Dennison,}who did all the carving in the nave along with the Estate joiner William Mawson. She also carved the pulpit, did most of the needlework and made the vestments which are still worn for the Eucharist. To enter the Sanctuary you have to pass under the{Rood-screen}where the figures were brought back from {Oberammergau.}On the North side of the altar is an Elizabethan monument commemorating{William Cartwright,}his wife Grace and their twelve children.
